given: user is on the Kanban board
when: they click the 'View as Table' link
then: they are navigated to /table route showing all tickets in table format

when: user clicks on a column header
then: the table sorts by that column in ascending order and clicking again toggles to descending
the following fields support sorting: ticketNumber, title, status, priority, assignee, createdAt, updatedAt

given: the table is viewed on any device
when: screen width is below desktop breakpoint (768px)
then: the table becomes horizontally scrollable, and on desktop+ uses full available width

given: a user is viewing the table
when: they click on any table row
then: they navigate to the ticket detail page for that ticket

given: a user is on the table view
when: they click the 'Back to Board' button
then: they return to the Kanban board view

given: existing filters exist for search text, priority, and status
when: user applies filters in table view
then: the table displays only tickets matching the filter criteria and filter state persists when switching views

given: tickets are loading or no tickets exist
when: the table is loading OR no tickets match filters
then: a loading spinner/skeleton is displayed OR an empty state message with option to clear filters is shown
